text: On tap in a tulip at blackback: Pours hazy golden orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, pineapple, and some grass. Taste is loads of citrus, orange zest, grass, mild resin. Mild hop bitterness, lots of flavor, incredibly crisp. Great beer.
Pours a medium to dark cloudy orange with a white Ricky lacing that dissipated quickly. Aroma is a little funky with what surprising reminds me of Nelson, grass and orange. Moderate bitterness

Growler fill. Thick as a bag, bright gold. Messy, dense, sticky, lasting, white head. Looks great. Nose has grapefruit rind. Peach stone. White pepper. Some strawberry. Notes of green hop. Some sweet, ginger biscuit malts. Taste is light, gingery sweet. Turns oily, piny bitter. Stunning mouthfeel. Juicy and oily and ridiculously drinkable. Finishes light, juicy, and spicy bitter. Fantastic.

On tap at the Blackback, Waterbury VT.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a muddled hazy burnt orange color with a thin fingers white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Streamy to stringy lacing rode around the glass appropriately.
The aroma bleeds with a super bittersweet orange juicy pulpiness. Bittersweet grassy hoppy tones invade but extend a certain balance to the evasive malt backbone. Yes, that malt backbone is there, but exceptionally light.
The flavor leads into the balance of the orangey bittersweet juicy hops to the malts. Practically, an absolute perfect blend. Juicy orangey aftertaste charging finely into the finish.
On the palate, this one leans towards a medium bodied somewhat sessionably crisp yet bitter gripping harshness penetrating the IBUs seemingly appropriate, still with a nice balance for the most part.
Overall, hmmmm, well, what can I say, yes, another fantastic DIPA by Hill Farmstead.

Growler from brewery. Pours slightly hazy orange with some foamy head and some spotty lacing. Nose is floral and fruit, like peach. Flavours of maybe mango, possibly peach, some grapefruit, some spice. Taste medium bitter, light sweet. Full sticky body with medium carbonation. CRazy easy to drink.

2016-06-18. Hazy orange body, frothy off white head. 3+ Aroma has interesting pithy citrus character, notes of citrus oils. 7+ Flavour is pleasantly bitter and citrusy up front, notes of citrus peel. 7++ Average bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Pretty nice. 7/4/7+/3/16 Growler shared by Wilco.

[8505-20160618] Growler. Citrus fruity wood aroma. Hazy, orange red body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Bitter fruity citrus berry wood flavour. Medium-full body is fairly bitter. Good. (8/4/8/4/15) 3.9
(c/o wilco, w/ him, jercraigs)
Lightly cloudy golden, white head. Deep mango and tropical, honey. Lightly sweet. Fair bit of bitterness. Clean, fairly chewy body. Great.

Growler. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy, white head. Rich aroma, some tangerine, honeydew, melon, orange. Medium sweet flavour with moderate piney bitterness, dry pale bread, grapefruit, citrus peel. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming and resinous to finish, with lots more rindy citrus, grapefruit, melon, tangerine. Excellent.

Poured from growler thanks Willrunforbeer hazy golden orange with a nice one finger white head. Aromas of floral notes grass dank resin citrus and bread. Taste is smooth and soft light caramel orange grapefruit lingering balanced finish.
750ml growler. Pours golden brown with a pillowy off white head. Aroma is pine, orange, grapefruit. Soft. Flavor is light caramel, orange, grapefruit, pine. Grapefruit peel bitterness in the finish.
Shared growler at Aarons. Hoppy citrus light IPA with really nice notes. Liked this a lot.
750ml growler. Cloudy golden orange with a frothy white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, melon, stone fruits and orange with grassy and dank notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

On tap at Pony Bar. Pours hazy golden light orange, white head. Aroma is pine, caramel malts, floral hops, citrus. Flavor is bitter pine, citrus pith, caramel, bread, herbal/floral note. More of an edge here than other societies, bitter traditional DIPA.

Taste from growler at kickback share. Pours a hazy pale golden yellow orange with a slight white head. Aromas of lemon and tangerine and a bit of pine. Taste is more bitter than I was expecting but beer is pretty solid for a straight Columbus bomb. A tad on the syrupy side too. Been surpassed by the "new kids" but still good stuff.

750mL growler filled 5/27/16, drunk 6/9/16.Large, fluffy, well-retained, white head tops a lightly-to-moderately hazy, soft-brass gold body.Expecting a big grapefruit/pine nose, Im shocked to find, while definitely some pine and white grapefruit, A LOT of watermelon and mango. Very juicy and with only a touch of resin. Theres a touch of sourdough-like character that Im not sure belongs to the hops or a specialty malt, but it intrudes a little bit in to the overall enjoyment of the nose, but is fairly passing as the beer warms and breathes. Really takes on quite the dank and melon-filled character over time, leaving light biscuit and honey behind it and no alcohol or flaw.Fantastically soft, malty, tightly carbonated mouthfeel easily balances the moderate bitterness and pinch of pine/white grapefruit. Lots of pleasant, milder tangerin/orange/mango notes add loads of juiciness and theres a good shot of acidity on the end to give balance and clear the palate somewhat. Fantastic one, as usual....

750 mL flip too opened with ebone1988 in the hotel. The pour is a darker golden yellow with s th Im white head that falls down to a bubbly collar leaving some awesome lacing. The aroma is juicy and bitter and lovely. There is an awesome bitter hop with a light dankness on the back end. I like it. The flavor is good. There is a juicy hop with a lot of pine resin and bitterness. Its really good. I love the juiciness. He dank hops and line resin are just a bonus of complexity. The mouth feel is good. There is a light to medium body to it with a softer carbonation and a lingeringly bitter citrus and resin hoppiness. This is a damn good beer.

Sample at Hill Farmstead with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, tropical fruit, juicy, citrus, resin, booze. Appearance is golden amber, white head, mostly clear. Taste is juicy, pine, tropical fruit, dank, citrus, great. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, magnificent. Overall, this is one tasty brew

Couleur orangé et opaque comme toutes les bières de cette série. Un mélange de sucre tropical et damertume intense nous transportent vers une complexité étrange mais tellement intéressante. Des saveurs de pamplemouse, résine, orange, caramel et herbes fraîches se mélangent à merveilles dans ce divin nectar. Sublime, complexe et excessivement bien balancé.

Tap. Cloudy dark gold with a thick, foamy, off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of pine, grass, grapefruit, light biscuit and caramel. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, grass, biscuit, and light caramel and apice. Medium bodied, smooth with a slightly dry bitter end.

Appearance- cloudy dark straw/light Amber
Aroma- hippy with subtle fruit presence
Taste- tart fruit at the beginning followed by a hop surge

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler thanks to Charles. Pours a hazy orange gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit, mango and grapefruit, pine, resin. Medium mouth, juicy hop, dank, pine, lingering resin finish, very nice.

Points en extra pour loriginalité. Habituellement lorsque je bois des IPAs "standards" elle sont soit ultra amères ou ultra sucrées. Celle-ci combine les deux alors que lon perçoit à une assez forte amertume, tout en ayant le côté assez sucré et exotique de la mangue et de lananas. Cest franchement original et rafraîchissant. On perçoit à peine les 8% dalcool, rendant cette bière fort agréable.

Tasted on 4/13/16 from a 750mL swing top growler, big thanks to Drews for sharing. Pours clear pale orange with a thick white head that has some real staying power, leaving thick lace. The nose is earthy and floral hops, with some nice citrus, and just enough balancing bread malt. The flavor is a bit more bread malt, with some earthy hops, plenty of grapefruit peel and softer lemon citrus. The body is medium, somewhat oily, with average carbonation, and a long bitter grapefruit peel finish.

Draft. Pours burnt orange with a thin white head that lingers. String grapefruit bitterness finish with some complexity up front. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

growler thanks to MacShawn. Nose is pretty earthy with light citrus. pour is hazy light orange with a small white head. Taste is where this one really shines. lots of light citrus and earthy hops. lingering bitter finish. no noticeable alcohol. great.

750ml growler bought by me, shared with only me. Pours gold. Off white head. Aroma of diesel/onion with tropical fruit. Taste is semi dry and bitter. Flavor has generous tropical hop expression. Light body, boost is hidden. This is God tier.

750 mL growler. Unknown original review date.
Light golden orange. Cloudy with a small head. Maybe due to the growler?

Smell is pine and then oodles of grapefruit. One-note Columbus hops. Grapefruit overload.

Taste is sweet and citrusy hops nearly giving it the tartness of a fresh grapefruit. I expect it to turn tart as if I was eating a grapefruit, but it turns very bitter, like the pith.

Very bitter flavor, medium-low carbonation. Lots of bitter hops make it tougher to drink that most IPAs.

Interesting. Way too grapefruity. Fascinating taste, but maybe too extreme. Another interesting experiment from HF. Had a later batch of this and really enjoyed it.

Draft at railroad. Pours sort of cloudy orange with a medium sized white head. The aroma has some lemon zest, citrus, pine. The taste has a very nice citrus punch, medium bitterness, a fruity, pulpy finish. This guy is very delicate for the abv but excellent.

A: Mildly Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Citrus, Mildly Piney, Mildly Yeasty

T: Citrus, Piney, Mild Yeasty

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mild Drying

Overall, good but not a blow away DIPA, the yeast on the back end takes away from the hop character.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté chez Prohibition Pig (Waterbury, VT). Arôme: Goût dhoublons résineux avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse et de pin. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence damertume dhoublon en arrière goût. (Rating #5095)

growler. pours hazy pale yellow with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. juicy citrus and pale chewy malts, dankness, nice fruitiness - apricots and oranges. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily and good drinkability, lightly boozy tho, nice spicy-citrusy finish. balanced. another craftfully-made dipa.

Growler 750ml. Thx Huxxy.
Pours golden with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of pine, resin, fruits (including tropical stuff). Taste is of pine, resin, fruits (including tropical), malt, bitter, alcohol. Palate: Ligth-medium body. Overall: Very good. Interesting resin.

Pours a very light to yellow color with moderate white head. Aroma is muted with some grapefruit zest, slight dankness and pine. Taste is hay, pine, slight dank weed and some mild fruit. Weak mouthfeel. Rated blind in a DIPA tasting flight. Was not at all expecting this to be a Hill Farmstead.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Thanks to Collin for sharing this growler. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Grapefruit hop aromas. A little dry with a very good mouthfeel and good body. Grapefruit hop notes dominate. A little unbalanced.

Growler de 2 L, frais de la veille. Arômes moyennement intenses de houblon américain, rappelant surtout les agrumes et la résine. Robe blonde et trouble, effervescence assez faible et peu de mousse. En bouche, le houblon se montre relativement aromatique (en fait, assez peu pour une bière de cette brasserie) et montre un caractère fruité et résineux. Le malt est très délicatement mielleux. Finale moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée. Lalcool est plutôt apparent pour une bière à 8%. Une bonne double IPA, mais sous les standards de Hill Farmstead.

Growler. Pours cloudy yellow amber with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is fruity, citrus, cat piss, mineral. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet, mineral notes from the well water, light floral notes as well. Medium plus bitterness. Medium body, typical HF soft creamy mouthfeel. Another nice effort.

Cloudy golden orange, some foam but not much. Citrus and cat urine aroma. Very bitter, dank, mineral. Well integrated flavor but your mileage may vary depending on whether you enjoy this type of hops. Dry.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2013 Swing-top growler at the parentals, with my Dad. Pour is hazy yellow with a big white head and great lacing. Weedy, grassy, straw, biscuity, grapefruity, light urine, piney, orange peel, caramelly, and dank aroma. Taste is big dank, grassy, weedy, ganja, straw, hay, somewhat earthy, citrusy, candied fruits, and resinous with a huge bitter finish. Sticky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Really nice DIPA, and very well-balanced for such great hop characteristics.

A- unfiltered honey yellow with one half finger of white head.  S- grapefruit and full citrus, sun tea, spicy herbs, lemon pepper, lavender, honey, floral notes, along with some wet grass and musty malts.  M- good carbonation with some stickiness.  Medium bodied and a full palate.  T- orange peel, grapefruit, honey, malts and some mild rose petals to start.  Alfalfa, mild pepper, brown sugar, coriander, lemon and mustiness are up next and mingle with the malts, and grapefruit still present from the beginning.  Some metallic and mineral notes also in the middle.  The subdued ending is malty and bitter with more grapefruit and minerals that quietly hang around.  Maltiness is more prominent as it warms.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml growler thanks to onebigtymer11. Enjoying this on my 33rd birthday. Pours a hazy burnt orange color with a fluffy white head. Strong aroma of grapefruit, juicy citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, apricot, and biscuit malt. This beer is so well balanced and smooth. It's going down way to easy and fast! Loving this one.

750 ml growler from HFS. Bright yellow color with a steady ring of white head that laced the glass. Nose is mango, pineapple, grapefruit and a touch of piney hops. Flavor is mostly the same as the nose. Big juicy fruits and about every hop combination you can think of. Just enough malt to keep some of the hops at bay. Medium body with a real dry texture. Loads of pine hops with a lingering bitterness. Hops, hops and more hops.

Bright, translucent gold color with a frothy white head. Somewhat milder aroma of sweet pale malts, peach, mango, grapefruit, and citrus fruits. Sweetness is balanced with background bitterness. Smooth, crisp, with just a bit of alcohol presence. In between light and medium bodied.

Sampled at the brewery.  Pours Cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of a lot of citrusy and almost resiny hops plus a nice pale, caramel maltiness.  Flavor the same.  Average to smooth texture.  A great beer.

23rd September 2012Very hazy amber beer, good off white head. Palate is smooth with good fine carbonation. Minerals. Nice mellow fruity hops - blood orange and regular orange marmalade. Lesser lemon and grapefruit. Finishes neutral with a good bitter marmalade aftertaste.

750 mL growlers complements of Thorpe and Tucker.

Pours a cloudy pale golden amber color with a frothy, retentive large white head; ample lacing. Dank citrus nose, exceptionally pungent and hoppy with a strong malt and honey like sweetness. Like nose, strong malt body, more sweet than other HF DIPAs, with an exceptionally dry and bitter finish; pine and orange rind. Medium thick body, well carbonated and very little alcohol presence. Certainly tastes like an Imperial Harlan, not my favorite HF, but I welcome having a few growlers of this.

Thanks to Michael for acquiring the growler for me. Shared with Mike and Adam.

The beer is golden yellow and mildly hazy with a half inch of white head. Good retention and plenty of lacing.

The aroma is seductive. Oh my...citrus, crack, hops, voodoo magicks, etc.

The flavor offers a ridiculously smooth blanket of hops. Utterly chuggable. Not too sweet, with a ton of citrus. A touch of malt in the finish, but most definitely a showcase for the hops. This is exactly what I look for in a DIPA.

One of the most drinkable DIPAs I have ever had. 

Overall, this reaffirms that Hill Farmstead is one of the best breweries on the planet. Highly recommended.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 05-30-2012

32 oz. growler served in a Portsmouth tulip. Growler courtesy of Sean (Sean9689). Thanks again!

A: Pours a hazy gold color with nice orange hues. A fluffy white head forms on the pour and recedes to a nice sticky collar that leaves similar sticky sheets of lace.

S: Nice pineapple and mango tropical scents with a nice sweet oat malt flavor to compliment the hops.

T: The hops are a little more complex in the taste with some grassy undertones and sweet tropical fruits and nice sweet oat malts.

M: Medium bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel, but refreshing at the same time with a sweet fruity finish.

O: Another delicious and hoppy creation from HF. This a very balanced and flavorful DIPA that is a must try for any tropical fruit flavored fan.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 05-16-2012

In short: A highly aromatic sharp citrusy blonde IPA.  Another home-run in the Double IPA HF lineup.
How: Fresh growler consumed the day of purchase from the brewery
The look: Cloudy dark blond body topped by a medium white head with good retention
In long: Nose is an explosion of fruity (mostly citrusy) hops with grassy undertones.  In mouth I immediately recognize the signature HF IIPA malt backbone which to me is like a fresh baguette and crisp crackers with just enough sugars to oppose the hops in a loosing but valiant effort.  Also typical of HF IIPA is the super mouthfeel with many very soft bubbles, a beer you enjoy to keep in your mouth.  Hopping is intense and very bright, very grapefruity with also other citrus fruits and grass.  Bitterness level is pretty high, very bright and just sharp enough to make it refreshing without being too aggressive.  Another Hill Farmstead Double IPA that I drank like a 5% session IPA.  Great stuff as usual.  Sometimes after I visit Hill Farmstead I like to close my eyes and imagine how great it would be if this brewery was locally available to me, and Im all like Wow, that would be so awesome and my wife is all like Watch the road!  Watch the fucken road!!!

Served on-tap at Teresas Next Door during Philly Beer Week.

A - Pours peach orange with a frothy one and a half finger tall white head leaving small trails of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of fresh cut tropical fruit and pungent citric hops from start to finish. Some lightly toasted grains and a touch of booze are present as well.

T - Starts off with plenty of citric hop bitterness slowly giving way to hints of citric zest, a bit of sweetness and a tiny bit of booze. Finish has plenty of hop bitterness, leaving the palate dried long after the finish.

M - Crisp body with a ton of hoppy flavor and moderate carbonation. Plenty of hop bitterness throughout, a touch of sweetness toward the end, with a bit of dryness at the end of each sip.

O - As typical with the hoppy HF beers, this ones description is spot on. Not as good as the What is Enlightenment? I had but still a very good DIPA.

Hazy light copper color. Large white head with decent lacing. Aroma is fruity with citrus hops. Body is medium with light carbonation. Finish is a bit dry but with a pleasant bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks, Patrick! Gorgeous bright orange pour, with a modestly creamy consistency, some healthy looking sediment as if the beer was fresh-squeezed, and a booming potent head. This is basically Heady Topper with a bit more spice, huge body and full mouthfeel, massively floral flavors. Columbus everywhere. Spruce, grapefruit rind, hop pellet. Very reminiscent of Heady! Thats boss.

Growler from the brewery...Hazy light copper pour,two finger head, good lacing.Aroma is fruity citrus hop . Nice citrus hop flavor with notes of pine and  resin. Medium bodied, soft carbonation . Finish is dry with a lingering bitterness.

750 ml flip top.  Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized white head that leaves decent lacing.  The aroma has big floral and resin hops, some grapefruit citrus and catty notes.  Minimal malt presence.  The flavor has a doughy malt base with some yeast that gives way to citrus, resin and herbal hops.  Good bitterness at the finish that last for a while; dry.  Another in the long line of solid offerings from HF.

Pours a deep hazy gold aroma of bitter pine and grapefruit. Taste follows, a bit heavy and dry. Malts are there but overpowered by the hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry & GregClow -- c/o Glouglouburp. May 15. Pours a hazy, very bubbly, golden-orange with a large lasting fluffy white head. Good lacing on the glass. Aroma: Wow! The lovely, big hoppy aroma is citrusy, resiny, piney and juicy along with lots of fruit and thats pretty much it, its all about the hops and I love it. Flavour: Wow again! Hoppy, hoppy, hoppy! Theres some alcohol there but only a little. Big bitter finish. Medium bodied. This is simply amazing!

pour is a dark hazy peach with a slightly off white head and decent lace. The nose is extremely nice, heavy grapefruit and citrus, notes of orange peel and zest. The taste offers more grapefruit, fairly tart, nice citrus in the back and assertively gentle bitterness in the finish. The body is airy and soft with a fair carbonation and semi dry finish. This is a great ipa with an extremely assertive hop, nice tropical notes, with enough malt undertones in the nose and flavor to keep it in check.

Cant decide which I like better: this or Heady Topper. Definitely up there with the top Double IPAs Ive tried. Complex aroma and taste, with a very clean but lingering finish. Truly lovely beer. From a 750ml bottle fresh from the brewery.

Medium statured white head, good retention and lace.earthy, piney nose, juicy. body is almost medium with a soft carboantion, lil resiny. Nice juicy, fruity hop flavors with a light malt undertaking, almost west coatish. Dry fruity finish with a tame bite. Still very nice. Props to  dtmets84 for the bomber.

Lightly hazy orange color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of floral hops, strong pine, herbal, some orange, and light citrus. Taste of citrus, pine, herb, light tobacco, and a grapefruit finish.

On tap at Boilermaker.  Poured a cloudy deep golden orange with a medium sized creamy white head.  Big citrus aroma of tangerine, clementine, papaya, followed by hints of caramel malt and piney hops.  Citrus is more apparent in the flavor and peachy apricot notes introduce themselves, wonderfully balanced by a pine resin mouthfeel and a smooth finish.

Draft at Jose Pistolas... Nice pour! Bright orange in color, good head. Smells great. Lots of tropical fruits. Taste just like it smells. Fruity, light grapefruit, orange, light mango. No one particular flavor stands out, well balanced. Light/medium body. JUICY! Really easy to drink. Overall I would of been happy drinking this all night long

On tap at boiler, pours glowing mimosa orange, large clear tiny bibble head, amazing lacing. Aromas of fresh hops, citrus fruits, pepper, pine. Taste is sweet citrus, tangy columbus hops, cheese, orange peel, malt, earthy grains and grass, bitter finish. Awesome

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 @ Boilermaker.  Appearance is medium orange-straw.  Large white head.  Spotty lacing.  Grapefruit, mango, pineapple and a fair bit of resinous hops.  Somewhat muted for an imperial.  Flavor is a bit drowned out by an aggressive (but not crazy) bitterness which distracts a bit from the grapefruit and tropical fruits.  Medium bodied.  Moderate to high carbonation.  Dry finish.
Aroma of pine and slight dark citrus with a hint if apricot.  Pours orange with a nice film.  Taste is citrussy with slight grass and pine.  Very dry and bitter.

On tap at Jose Pistolas.  Misty orange brown with a clingy white head.  Nose is toffee, mango and orange.  Medium body with soft carb.  Tastw is pink grapefruit, bitter grass, orange peel and pine.  Long dry dank finish.
Tap at Hill Farmstead and Parker Pie.  Fucking awesome like all HF IPAs.  Had this while playing some trivia with Shaun at Parker Pie and eating some delish pizza.  dont sleep on vermont.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured hazy golden copper color with an average to large frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Medium to heavy complex floral hop aroma. Medium to full body with slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy smooth bittersweet herbal flavor with a medium to heavy complex bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.

tap at HF ann party.  easily one of my favorite beers of the day during a day of many wonderful beers.   Harlan is one of my favorite HF brews, think i gave it like a 4.6 or something.   imperial harlan?  well i would sure love to try it.   quite good.   aroma explodes with huge juicy tropical fruits, grapefruit, and fresh juicy oranges.     hop forward for sure, but not overly bitter.   pleasant apricot and orange fruit sweetness lends nice balance.  dry.   ultra tasty fresh on tap from the source.    real nice.

750 growler from Carps. Thanks! dirty orange pour with a big soapy white head.  Herbal, tropical, and a bit of onion hops in the nose. not much going on beside the hops, which is fine with me. Flavor is pretty cool like that too. No hint of the ABV, lighter body than I expected with less carbonation than I had expected. good.

The pour was hazy and cloudy like the sky yesterday except the color of gold with a white head.  Aroma hop bomb for sure with a lot of citrus on the nose.  More citrus on the taste with a plethora of hoppiness.  Oh, what a wonderful beer!
Shared by Dak.  Pours a hazy grapefruit color with an eggshell head.  Aroma has some dank hops but also loads of sweet, citrusy hops.  Taste is sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied.  Friggin awesome!

Flip-top growler from joebones3.  Thanks!  Hazy gold color, tight white foam on top, spotty lacing left on the glass.  The aroma has big whiffs of tropical fruit; lemon rind, mango, and grapefruit coming to mind.  Theres some pine noted as well.  Not really any malt here.  Going down this is medium-bodied, getting a little doughy malt flavor underneath a blast of tropical fruity hops.  A bit herbal.  The finish has a lengthy dry and bitter finish with notes of pine.  Some alcohol heat sneaks in there toward the back end.  Incredibly drinkable, though.  I like the lower abv for a Double IPA.  Excellent stuff.
Cloudy dark gold pour. White head. Dank, spicy, citrus hop aroma abounds!! Flavor is citrus, juicy hops, and hops! Hops!!!

swing top from ernesto! shared at tasting full of stouts and sours and this guy stole the show. poured hazy orange with frothy white head and it was 2 weeks old! aroma bursting with fruit and grass. taste was so fresh and fruity hoppy good god this was amazing

Oh my. NOT disappointed.  Holy crap. Hazy yellow/orange with a large long-lasting fluffy off white head. Smells like heaven - floral, citrus and tropical fruit, not much alcohol.  Taste follows, a little more alcohol and the floral bitterness asserts more than the tropical fruit, and wonderfully catty too - could go 9/10 too. Perfect light body, moderate acidity and alcohol with a medium-long bitter finish - so good, and soooooo easy to drink too.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 Huge thanks to a great trader for getting this growler out my way.  Served in a Hill Farmstead long stem tulip.  Pours a nice orange color with a good white head and a bit of lacing.  Nose carries loads of dank hops.  Columbus heaven.  Cant get enough.  Body is light-medium with really nice bitterness.  Fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared a growler. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma is grapefruits, hops, sweet malts. Flavor was a nice tropical fruit hop mix with nice sweet malts. Flavor was great, bitterness is good, with a balanced finish. Surprised.

750 ml growler from the Farmstead. A slightly hazy light orange brew. Lacy head. Good carbonation. Sweet-spice aromas. Flavor profile has a very well balanced sweetness. Hop profile is fruity-spice-citrus. Some grapefruit. More spice. Some spruce. Lingering bitter-citrus peel flavors. Very nice - better than Heady Topper!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Capping bottle, or half a growler.  Cloudy orange colour, lots of lace.  Hoppy, fresh and citrus aroma.  Above average mouthfeel, but hop pellet bitterness.  Raw and not the greatest drinkability.  Dissapointing experience. 
I was even more disapointed when having it again from growler 4 years later.

Big thanks to Kan for sharing.  Excited to try another Hill Farmstead.  As this was my second Hill Farmstead, my impression overall of both of them was that they are very focused beers.  They seem to highlight the hops and thats about it, which is not a bad thing at all.  Extremely clean and both beers finished very dry.  I could really start to crave this straight forward bold style.  In the taste and aroma there is plenty of tropical fruit, piney resinous hops, pineapple and lemon.  Huge flavor but not too thick or too sweet.  Really just a well made beer.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Murky gold in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas are a blend of tropical and pink grapefruit smelling hops, a bit of cut grass and mild pale malt. Papaya upfront in the mouth, followed by pink grapefruit, pale malt, minerals, and a bit of grass. Firm bitterness, but less than youd expect from the hopping level. Kick ass stuff to say the least.
Hazy golden, persistent small white cap, loads of pine and pineapple, some grapefruit pith. Juicy mouthfeel with a lingering bit of astringency

Hazy gold 1 finger of head.  Lots of lacing.  Grapefruit zest, mango, floral hoppy aroma.  Wave of bitter hops up front, grapefruit, pine, zesty with a bit of young pineapple.  Good carbonation medium body.

750mL Bottle. Thanks for sharing, Emeline. Why, Shaun, why? Why do you beers have to be so damn good. Why cant they just be good, or great, or fine. Why fan-mother-fucking-world-class fantastic? This is hard to finger, but the best way to put it is emergent. Theres layer between this and all other Double IPAs. Theres something undefinable, unattainable, and unknowable that separate the qualities of this. Yeah, it smells like its got 3,000 pounds of fresh Simcoe in the aroma. Yeah, its super fresh, super potent, super clean, and super concentrated hop flavor. But, its also....something else. Something above and beyond. Something balance and something special. Its just a hoppy beer like none Ive ever had before and the line that makes it that is undefinable.

Growler Pours hazy and yellow with a small, fizzy, white head. Good retention. The bouquet is a mélange of grapefruit, cat piss, lemon peel and dank hops. Medium-bodied with a sandy mouthfeel and busy carbonation. The flavor is medium to heavily bitter and presents a great deal of grapefruit rind. Raspy, bitter, tongue-numbing finish. Kudos to landhoney for sharing this rarity! I am so glad I had the chance to try it.

Taster from brewery. Pours a hazy golden color.... with an aroma of fresh hops, citrus, flowers and maybe a little bubble gummy in a good way. . tastes like grapefruit with a bitter hop finish as how it should be. another amazing  Double IPA by Mr. HIll and Crew. thanks a bunch Shaun!!

Picked up at Hill Farmstead on 4-21. Put it in the fridge. Poured into an HFS glass on 4-23. 

A - Poured beautifully. Half a finger cream colored  head with some decent head lacing. The bubbles stuck around for a while. The beer is a beautiful orange gold color SRM of 3 with lots of clouds / haze in the glass. Really spectacular looking.

S - Shaun was right. Totally an Imperial Harlan by scent. Really nice hop profile that fills the nostrils. Ruby red grapefruit, nectarine and other great citrus scents. Hints of lemon as well with a wee bit of honey. Just the right amount of hoppiness.

T - Heavenly. Very few beers taste like they smell. Very rich grapefruit juice, tangerines and some melon. Great hop finish that covers the tongue and stays around for a while.

M - 95% carbonation on the mouth swish, medium body and very dry finish. Carbonation is almost champagne-like.

O - Society 2 was my favorite black IPA. Society 3 may be my favorite Double IPA. Another fantastic tasting beer from Shaun Hill. The only thing wrong with it is the lack of it being on tap at my house to drink every night.
On draft pour.  Cloudy yellowish orange color.  Nice white head.  Citrus piney smooth refreshing double iPa.  Norway body.

750 ML from brewery. Pours a hazy dull golden color.... with a snappy aroma of fresh hops a touch of tropical fruit and grass.  The flavors are spot on crisp and direct.  Great flavors of grapefruit, pine and a slight floral bouquet lead into a classic bitter hop finish. Clean easy drinker for an 8% Double IPA.

750 ml fliptop shared by Kan. Thanks, man! Pours a rich dulled golden orange hue. Firm haze with with a loose ringing offwhite head that sticks around, laces small. Aromas are dank, tons of lemon and weedy hops. Some tropical elements, grapefruit, melon. Tons of melon piles on, some bready malts, grass, and tropical fruit, oranges. Rich hoppy nose. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied preaching firm bitterness up front, dry lemons and grass, florals and tons of melon. Some tropical fruit, gentle grapefruit, more florals, bready malts. Middle shows a fruity melange, mellow sweetness, dry florals and a kick of ABV heat as we move towards the backend. Sun tan lotion and lemons, dry firmness, kicking the palate and lingering finish. Very fruit forward, dry clean finish. Surprisingly small malt element, touches of heat in the finish. Pretty nice. Could use a more lingering rich hoppy dryness. Solid. Great nose and front end.
Another outstanding offering from Mr. Hill.   Being a double ipa its strong but not overpowering.  Good balance of hops and citrus.  Slight floral note as well.  Very clean beer. (well water)

Thanks Kan, pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma has big cat box, hop resin, piney, citrus tangerine. Flavors are big juicy tangerine, resin, and pine. Med body. Real clean, hoppy, and dry. Awesome beer!

Growler from John, delivered fresh from HF. Translucent bright orange with a light biege head. Powerful without overwhelming citrus - peach and some pineapple seem to balance things out -  also get some nice resin, and a muted  doughy malt too. Moderate carbonation, fairly full body, nice balanced bitterness that grows to a great finish with amazing citrus and pine - alcohol finally appears at the end. Delicious.

Tasted on several occasions fresh from the tap while in Vermont. Light golden orange color with a touch of haze in the glass. Fluffy white head. Aromas begin with what seems to be the earthy dankness of the Columbus hops. Flavors full of floral, grassy, and citrus notes. Mixture of hop flavors going on here.Tangerine, lemon, and grapefruit. Super fresh clean flavors. No hint of heat or alcohol. Finish is perfectly dry and balanced. Loved it.

Growler 750 ml. Appearance: Cloudy yellow/orange. Creamy white head and nice lacing. Aroma: Peaches, citrus and hops. Very nice fruity nose. Taste: Citrus, fruits and pine. Strong bitterness and lingering pungent aftertaste. Overall: Good stuff, very nice DIPA with HF signature.

Growler thanks to largadeer.  Hazy golden orangish color with a one finger white head that fades to foam.  Big grapefruit on the aroma, supremely hoppy with some honey malt notes.  The flavor has very mild sweetness balanced by huge, huge grapefruit hops.  Really intense and tasty.  Medium-bodied with enamel-shredding bitterness.  Excellent DIPA.

750mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany!), pours a cloudy orangey yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is very piney and floral hop-heavy, with truckloads of piney hops and balanced doughy malt to back. Flavour begins exceedingly piney, with loads of resinous and floral hops as well, some citrus and grapefruity in there as well. The malt backing isnt obvious from the flavour, but the palate is quite thick and chewy for a Double IPA. Finishes dry, with loads of piney and some herbal (a bit pot-like) hops. Absolutely beautiful.

On tap at Prohibition Pig in Waterbury, VT. Pours a cloudy, bright orange, gold tinted body with a finger-width, dense, foamy and frothy, pure white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a lot of lacing. Pretty gorgeous beer. Aroma is big grapefruit and citrus pine resins with some tropical fruits and a light caramel. Lots of fresh citruses on the nose here. Flavor is similar. Lots of juicy citruses up front with plenty of pine resins and big floral tropical fruits. A light bready caramel behind the fresh hops before the grapefruits come out nicely towards the end with lots of floral fruits and citruses. Finishes dry with a moderate bitterness before leaving a lengthy aftertaste. Very soft, medium-light body with a ultra soft, moderate, almost fluffy feeling carbonation. Overall, an excellent DIPA. Wonderful balance and such a nice feel to this. Tons of fresh citruses balanced well with florals, pines, and tropical fruits as well as just a touch of malt backing. This was pretty awesome.

A - Pours a murky golden-yellow color with a finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is a full of tropical, citrus, and pine hops, with some grapefruit and pineapple, and some sweet caramel malt.

T - Starts off with some citrus and tropical hops with lots of grapefruit and pineapple flavor with some bitterness and a bit of sweet caramel malt. Through the middle piney and earthy hops come through with stronger bitterness and some more sweet malts. The finish is a mix of tropical and citrus fruits, with lots of grapefruit, some resiny pine, bitterness, and a bit of sweet malt.

M - Medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a resiny, dry, and bitter finish.

D - Very drinkable. Big hop forward DIPA with lots of citrus and tropical fruits and bitterness coming through. Hop profile is really nice from start to end.

Pour out of growler, thanks Aaron! Hazy yellow-orange pour with nice fluffy white head, nice looking brew.  Aroma brought notes of big dank resinous hops, touch of biscuit and spicy floral notes, big fruity tropical fruit as well but mainly like a big bag of dank...hops. Taste is nice big bitter and dank hops, hints of biscuit and spicy hops, big grapefruit and more resinous hops. Wow this is like a bag of weed in a beer, but in a good way.
Bitter finish. Dry palate. Floral aroma and nose.  I find the aroma wonderful but understated. A fine ipa.

Growler @ Dans house, courtesy of glouglouburp. Huge thanks! Pours a hazy, light, bright, golden orange appearance with a nice white head that doesnt have the best retention. Huge piney, ganja, somewhat resiny hoppy aroma. Somewhat sweet grapefruit citrusy, big piney, ganja, sticky hoppy flavor with a fairly piney aftertaste. Great beer.

750 swingtop courtesy of Steve at the LeBleu release.  Pours a hazyd golden amber with a thick white to beige head.  Sweet citrus and pine on the nose.  Thick body, deep pungent citrus and grapefruit.  Beautiful.  Smooth, long earthy grapefruit and quinine.  Lingering grapefruit with a  lengthy bitterness.
Growler shared by Steve. Cloudy yellowish orange with white head. Nose/taste of citrus, tropical fruits, malt, yeast, fresh grapefruit and lemony bread. Medium body.

My Bottom Line:
Citrusy hop resins flourish within and atop this Imperial IPAs cushiony mouthfeel, as lengthy bitterness and a lightly sand-y nature add even more personality.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A fluffy head of foam decorates the cloudy beige-y golden.
-Hop flavor is multifaceted and beautifully bright.
-The focus on this one is more on the citrus than, say, a Heady Topper.
-The comfy, fluffy carbonation and lean residual sugars carve a perfect mouthfeel.
-Drinkability is through the roof for such a big brew.

On tap at the brewery and from a growler.

On tap at the Biere de Norma release. Beautiful orange-gold with thick white head. Aroma is wet grass, citrus (peach), honey and onion. I really hate onion aroma in IPAs but this was well dosed and worked well. Nice grassy flavors and citrus peel. Full bodied and sharp. Classic Hill Farmstead IPA.

750mL flip-top thanks to oteyj. Pours glowing gold, hazy, with a massive, egg white rocky head with huge retention. Big lace. Nose is holy dear god of gods. Ultra dank butterscotch and starfruit nose with huge marijuana. Ohh. Taste is bitter with excellent yellow nectar fruit balance. Huge mango skin and unrepentant mango flesh. Approaches what I remember batch 1 of Sculpin being. So much fresh mango and pineapple with quenching butterscotch malt. Amazing. Saltwater in the finish with heavy yellow grapefruit pith. Very long oily grapefruit finish. Amazing. I hate Double IPAs. Thankfully no other brewery in the world can make them this good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to oteyj for bringing this back from the Biere de Norma release! Cloudy peach pour with a magnanimous, gigantic white frothy head. Nose holds huge white grapefruit, leek and green onion, bitter lemon and orange rind, dank pot and spruce. The flavor is a bit softer but still gorgeous, with more monstrous grapefruit, touches of nectarine and sweeter orange flesh, pine sap, scallion, and hop oil, and an incredibly dry, smacking finish that melds with that characteristic supple mouthfeel in Shauns beers. Outstanding IPA, one of the best on the planet in my book.

A hazed amber ale with a thin creamy frothy off white head. In aroma, classic Hill pungent hops, catty and smooth, orange pulp, a bit of Brett notes. In mouth, biscuit malt with piney hops, catty notes, citrus pulp, beautiful. On tap at Three Penny Taproom, April 6, 2012.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thick and creamy white head...nice retention and lacing.  Aroma has nice stonefruits...peach, mango...and some grassy spice.  Flavor follows suit...nice tropical fruit notes with solid bitterness.  Mouthfeel is medium/full...lively yet oily...with a fruity/bitter dry finish.  Tasty.

On tap at the Biere de Norma release, and a couple growlers afterwards. A vibrant light hazy golden body gives way to a massive tight frothy head with amazing retention and lace. Amazing aromas of citrus, herbal dankness, scallion/ green onion, and nectar fruits. The hop profile in the flavor is accentuated by outstanding dryness, allowing for an absolute Columbus onslaught. Nectary peach, apricot, scallion, and orange peel meld together in pretty amazing ways. Very reminiscent of the Columbus single hop, as well as Harlan, both of which I enjoyed immensely. The palate is light, dry, crisp, and dank. All the hop character shines through powerfully. Really awesome beer.

Draft at Prohibition Pig - Pours a hazy golden-amber in color with a medium bright white head that held on to produce some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is citrus hoppy with caramel malts and some fruity esters... mango, peach?  Flavor is citrus hops, some tropical fruits (mango!) and caramel malts.  Finishes with lingering hop bitterness with some sweetness at the end.  Really good...
Draught from el tigre.  Poured a slightly tinted gold, lots of head. Fruity yet piney. Decent but pretty light for an iipa?
Hazy golden hue with nearly non-existent head. Piney hops. Refreshing. Not full bodied.

Draft. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Piney and lemony hoppy aroma with light pale malts. The flavor has fruity hops, with some honey-like sweetness, citrus fruits, and light pine. Good stuff, though everyone else seemed to like it way better than I did.

Draught at Blind Tiger, NYC - at Vermont Night. Cloudy yellow - white head. 
High citrus hoppy. Fruity. Light malty. Smooth body. Light bitterness. Very pleasant.

tap @ blind tiger- hazy copper/orange pour without much head and superb floral aromatics. Plenty of caramel malts and tropical fruits, sweet fruit juices. Lots of citrus and mellow sweet finish and lingering hop resins on the tongue.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 Draft at Blind Tiger with Scarlett and Jeremy. Pours a super bright, electric orange body with deep thick haze, and white creamy lacing. Aroma is super fresh fruit, mostly citrus, some mango, some bitter hop, pine, and floral notes. Mouthfeel is slightly dry, but still incredibly refreshing with notes of citrus fruits, pineapple, mango, grapefruit, pine, and floral hops. An outstanding double IPA.

Pours a very hazy golden slightly orange color with a small head that dissipates quickly. Smells familiar to other hfs ipas regarding esters.  Floral, piney, mango, grainy sweet straw malt, a bit of vegetal hop. Taste is very balanced between a intense hop floral pine and grainy straw malt. Mouthfeel is mostly dry. Medium full body.  No alcohol to smell/ feel/ taste. Mosty dry.  overall prefer the hop and malt profile in this compared to double galaxy.
I give this a Yum+.  Aroma is oranges, spruce, resin.  Very sticky and quite bitter.  Columbus and Citra? possibly.  They dont make a bad beer.. the streak continues.

Growler of this stuff I "swung by" during the lawsons anniversary party. Again, feel like a broken record. A perfect IIPA. Very citrusy, with a sticky resiny mouthfeel. Easy drinkability, its already gone! IF YOU GET THIS GET THE 2L. YOU NEED THAT MUCH TRUST ME!!!
